reviewText: Belly dancing is NOT stripping...why why why did Sarah Skinner have to make it into stripping in her DVD titled Seven Veils "Romantic" Bellydance!? I really wanted to like this...but I have to agree with the reviewer who compared Sarah Skinner to one of the Barbies from Toy Story. Sarah's performance could only be described as "a stripper on Prozac." She actually rolls around the floor at one point, crazy eyes unblinking, with a scary grin on her face the whole time. I was embarrassed for her.The costumes are gorgeous, and there is a section about making your own costumes (which you can easily find for free on google by the way). If you want belly dance technique that is both beautiful and sensual and doesn't try too hard, try Sensual Bellydance with Blanca instead of this.I gave this a generous 1 star because the costuming portion was creative and informative and I'm also a crafty person named Sarah.I'd recommend this for people brand-new to belly dance. And for those who need new coasters.Read more of my juicy & true fitness reviews at:[...]
Title: N/A

reviewText: Sarah Skinner is a talented costume artist and performer. She has an approachable style of teaching belly dance. This DVD teaches a fun routine with veils and even shows you how to make the veils and create your own costume. You also get to see Sarah Skinner perform. The major flaw with this video (hence the four stars rather than five) is that it presents macabre details about John the Baptist's murder that are not only historically inaccurate, but offensive. There really is no connection between belly dance and Salome's dance, and tying belly dance to gruesome murder just ruins the fun. It really reminded me of making light of the deaths of those who died by guillotine in the French revolution. This is the 21st century and our art should have progressed beyond tasteless ridicule of those who have been oppressed and murdered. Just because something evil happened in past doesn't make it funny. It would be like making fun of the holocaust or the Armenian genocide. Those segments referring to Herod and Salome and showing representations of John's bloody head on a charger should just be removed. If I had the ability to import the video and cut those parts out, I would, since the rest of the video is really quite good.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an instructional for a short veil choreography based on the "seven veils" story. This choreo has a very exotic, feminine, sensual feel to it. It's alot of fun to dance to.  She even gives tips & ideas on what to do, if you wish to mezmerize your special "Sultan" for a romantic evening. Sarah is really great, from costumes, to teaching you how to look flawless  and radiate beauty & romantic sensuality in your dance. The moves taught in this choreo can be accomplished by a beginner with some experience, but for the complete beginner, it might be helpful to have some of the bellydance basics.This choreography does not contain alot of veil tricks, (and not anything new if you are expeirenced with the veil)-if you are looking for that, you might want to try Sarah's other veil DVD. It's excellent. This dance is based on the Biblical "Seven Veils" story. Simply put: draping the veils on your body, dancing, and how to take them off gracefully.Also included, is Sarah's lavish "Seven Veils" performance that is just fantastic --really beautiful to watch. Sarah is such an amazing dancer! The production quality is excellent- with lavish costuming. Not the regular old bellydance performance-It much more like theater.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Again, this artist puts out such beautiful videos. The costumes are beautiful, the setting is goregeous. These are things that a lot of videos don't have and I really enjoy this kind of beauty. While i enjoyed the presentation and the way this artist expresses her intention, i did not enjoy the choreography. However, this is a great video for getting the imagination going and creating your own story. This is a good DVD for begginers who would like to transiton from basic movement into dancing with a veil. All levels of dancers may be interested in the imagination this artist taps into.

reviewerName: Kat Steele "RYT, LMT, Belly Dance Instructor ...
reviewText: While most of Miss Skinner's dvd's are put together with solid dance information,I was not impressed with this one. It really was not a 7 veil dance. However her instruction is pure. I was hoping for a new twist to the seven veils and feel she came up short. I'm not sure how scarfs work for a belly dance routine as it felt like she was trying to have seven pieces of materials. However the red veil covering was interesting.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Sarah starts this with a history lesson about the origin of the dance of the seven veils.  (This dance has its origins in the marriage of Harrod to his brother's wife.  His stepdaughter Salome is actually doing the dance.  There is also some discussion of the origin of the veils;  they may be symbolic of the seven deadly sins, and their removal symbolizes showing one's true self.)After the biblical storytelling, Sarah shows you what kinds of veils that you will need and how they should be held or placed in your costume.  The instruction progresses to how to dance with the veils.The instruction is very clear, and Sarah has a good sense of humour that helps the instruction along.  The dance itself is inventive, impressive, and doesn't actually take that much bellydance skill.This would be a good purchase for a dancer who wants to be able to perform something impressive without a lot of prior experience.  If you can count, you can probably do this dance.  It's really imaginative, and looks a lot more difficult than it really is.

reviewText: In this dvd Sarah Skinner teaches a very sensual and simple choreography you can dance for your "special someone". She also explains how to create a nice and simple costume. Recommended for bellydancers of all levels!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Sarah skinner-Romantic Belly Dance Seven VeilsBefore writing a review, I was determined to learn the entire contents of this  dvd. At great length, I did so and my reward has been an enrichment to my dance language, increased fluidity, sensuality in floor work while  improving on basic veil tricks.The floor work in this program is exquisitely performed by Sarah Skinner. In brief, Sarah marvels her audience as she goes through her 7 veils, without heavy draped on fabrics, but rather making great use of kerchiefs which are just as effective and flirty.The romantic bellydance dvd has in content:Sarah welcomes her audience by sharing her interpretation of the famous story of Salome and the 7 veils as  redone by Oscar Wilde, the number seven coming into a curious play and interpreted into a personal vision;  a brief history of veils, types of fabrics and varying lengths..For this great, fun veil dance program, you will need:3 long veils, 4 kerchiefs in varying sizes; (as you will learn how to drape yourself.)Included also in the program:*Upper body warm up, beautiful hand and arm articulations*Spine and torso warm up, proper posture*Hip movement using inner core muscles*A segment devoted to floor work, how to change levels using hipwork, cute flirty tricks on the floor*Veil tricks and switches, cascades and a beautiful choreography integrating all of the above.*A complete step through into the choreography with Sarah guiding gently and thoroughly beginning with the first veil and to end with veil seven.*Great tips on using the veil to interact with the audience*How to decorate a bra top, head piece and much more!There is so much packed into this great program. In addition, enjoy a sultry and playful choreography with Sarah and Dancers.A very thorough veil program, for the beginner, or those well versed, there is much to learn. The material presented in a fun approachable manner.The costuming is gorgeous, the music is drawing, captivating, and lending to the dance of veils as you flow back in time to a time of Salome and her dance of the seven veils.....
Title: N/A

reviewText: Sarah begins with an introduction to veils, including some of the fabrics and types of edging that can be used.  She then demonstrates several ways to wear the veils.  She shows you how to  wear the veils for the choreography she teaches.  The choreography is beautiful and easily followed.  Sarah is beautiful and a pleasure to watch.  Follow along with her and you will be beautiful in your dance!  Sarah demonstrates how to make an economical costume for yourself out of a bra, mirrors, trim, glitter glue and necklaces.  The performances on this video are lovely.  Sarah not only performs the choreography taught, but also performs "Salome's Sin" with a chorus of other beautiful dancers.  This DVD would be suitable for beginners that have a grasp of most of the basic moves, but it is also appealing for any dancer that loves veils, great music, a little theatrics, and simply elegant choreography.Sarah wears some gorgeous costumes on this DVD.  She is a talented costume designer as evidenced in the costume she designed for the front cover.  I found this to be a very enjoyable DVD.
